results.title: Moral development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Examines two opposing theories of moral development, that of Lawrence Kohlberg who believes that there are stages of moral development tied to cognitive development, and that of the learning theorists who contend that moral behaviour like all behaviour is learned, and that reasons for actions are irrelevant. Using Dr Stanley Milgrim’s famous obedience experiment each of the six stages of moral reasoning is represented in this film, one at a time, by six different participants. The stages differ in the types of reasons a person gives for making a decision about a moral dilemma and in the type of concern the person shows for the self, society, and authority.

results.title: Language development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Shows the most current research being done on language development, such as Dr David Premack’s work at the University of California teaching language to chimpanzees. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 - Violet
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 7 – Indigo was broadcast as the seventh of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Future Films (Jeff Jaffers), Third Eye ‘Ambi Jam’ (Gus Till, Ollie Olsen, Geoffrey Hales, Simon Polinski), Cyberdada (Troy Innocent & Dale Nason), Phuture (Crissie Seivers and M. Buchanan ‘Equinox Comics’), Stelarc, Theatre TV (Eliza, Mari Giambanco and Julie Turner), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), Corruption & Vice (Ju-Ann Lam), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason and Kim Bounds) and Dont Shoot The Messenger (Steve Middleton)

Cyberthon VII: Spectrum 7 – Violet is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on maturational and environmental factors; and the cognitive learning or cognitive behavioural approach subscribed to by such developmentalists as Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Suitable for tertiary and upper secondary levels.

Suitable for tertiary and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Emotional development: aggression
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Aggression is one of the least understood emotions. This film looks at the ways it is leant, when it is used and how aggressive skills are maintained. Alternatives to aggression such as co-operation and negotiation are also examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Jampel, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 6 - Indigo
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 6 – Indigo was broadcast as the sixth of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Force Fed (Stuart McCormick & Michael Brand), Magnetic Head Circuit (Chubba, Matt Bastard, Peter Randall), Antartica, Future, Wake up Return 2 Heart, Rave Safe Info (Melissa Dent & Michael Arnold), Air Fiction (Andy Taylor), Steve Law (Zen Paradox), Tom Cia, Derek ‘Chill’ Shiel and The Visitor (Andrew Till).

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 6 – Indigo is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

results.title: Cognitive development (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordan and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Describes and portrays two major theories of cognitive development: Jean Piaget’s developmental stage approach with its emphasis on environmental and maturational factors; and the cognitive, learning or behavioural approach of Jerome Bruner, Jerome Kagan and Sidney Bijou. Also examines Dr Siegfried Engelmann’s behaviorist view of intellectual development. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 - Red
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red was broadcast as the first of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason), The Visitor (Andrew Till) and Third Eye (Ollie Olsen).

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.
results.description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red was broadcast as the first of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

CREDITS:

STUDIO CREW
Director - Adem Jaffers
Technical Producer - Steve Middleton, CSG Staff
Graphics Operators - Lee Bristow, Dan Flett, Daniel Alisauskas
Tape Operator - Michael Lyons
Directors Assistant - Jacinta Hicken
Audio Engineer - Des Amos
Disc Jockey - The Visitor

PRODUCTION CREW
Producers - Adem Jaffers, Frank Peppard
Web Stuff - Gary Gallagher
Sponsorship - Catherine Carr
Publicity - Sunny Grace
Spectrum Fact-book Design - Melanie Carr
Spectrum + Neolithic Keeper Animation - Adem Jaffers
Music - Ollie Olsen, Brian St James, Danny Woodman

CONTRIBUTORS
